commitResults.messageBody:
The program currently lacks the functionality to persist data across
sessions, which means any information stored in the list is lost when
the program closes.

This limitation makes the application less user-friendly, as users
have to re-enter their data every time they run the program.
Persistent storage is necessary to improve usability.

Add methods to read and write to file to handle data storage and
retrieval.

The 'writeToFile()' method is used to store the current state of the
list into a file, 'arrayToNumberedString()' formats the data for
readability, and 'readFromFile()' is used to retrieve the stored data
when the program runs again. This approach ensures that data is
consistently saved and retrieved in a structured manner.

The program currently lacks the functionality to persist data across
sessions, which means any information stored in the list is lost when
the program closes.

This limitation makes the application less user-friendly, as users
have to re-enter their data every time they run the program.
Persistent storage is necessary to improve usability.

Add methods to read and write to file to handle data storage and
retrieval.

The 'writeToFile()' method is used to store the current state of the
list into a file, 'arrayToNumberedString()' formats the data for
readability, and 'readFromFile()' is used to retrieve the stored data
when the program runs again. This approach ensures that data is
consistently saved and retrieved in a structured manner.

The chatbot currently treats dates and times as plain strings,
limiting its ability to manage tasks effectively.

Proper date and time handling is crucial for managing deadlines and
events, making the chatbot more useful and user-friendly.

Refactoring the code to adhere to Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
principles will improve maintainability and scalability,
making the code more modular and easier to extend.

Extract the code into separate classes:
Ui: Handles user interactions.
Storage: Manages loading and saving tasks from/to a file.
Parser: Interprets user commands.
TaskList: Contains the task list and provides operations for
adding and deleting tasks.
Command: Represents the instructions the program can receive

All classes in the Light program are currently in a single namespace,
making it harder to manage and scale as the program grows.

Organizing the classes into packages improves code organization,
readability, and maintainability. It also allows for easier management
of the growing codebase as more classes are added.
Grouping related classes into packages also enhances modularity and
helps maintain a clean project structure.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/Light.java
#	src/main/java/command/AddCommand.java
#	src/main/java/command/DeleteCommand.java
#	src/main/java/command/ListCommand.java
#	src/main/java/command/MarkCommand.java
#	src/main/java/components/Storage.java
#	src/main/java/components/Ui.java
#	src/main/java/exceptions/LightException.java

The program does not currently include assert statements to verify key
assumptions at runtime.

Using assertions ensures that critical assumptions are valid, helping to
catch potential errors early in development.

Add assert statements at important points in the code to document and
validate assumptions.

Assertions act as a safeguard, only running during development, without
impacting performance in production when disabled.

Command represented by strings, poor naming of variables affects code
readability

Replacement of command strings by enums, restructuring of code allows
short and readable code

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug where the brackets are printed twice

commitResults.messageBody:
The program currently lacks the ability to undo or redo actions, making
it difficult for users to correct mistakes or revert changes.

Undo and redo functions improve the user experience by allowing users
to reverse unintended actions and restore previous states.

Implement an undo/redo feature by tracking changes to the task list
and allowing users to step backward or forward through their action
history.

This approach ensures actions can be easily reverted or reapplied,
improving flexibility and usability.

The implementation stores previous states to support multiple undo/redo
steps.

Tweak the GUI to match the asymmetric nature of the conversation: As the
 conversation is between the user and the app (not between two humans),
it is asymmetric in nature. Accordingly, it makes sense not to display
both sides of the conversion in the same visual format.

Add text bubble, add background, edit visuals
Fixed a bug where the product image on README was not shown

commitResults.messageTitle: Update README to include find and help instructions

commitResults.messageBody: Fix a bug where findcommand would crash when there is no keyword
